abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Santa Catarina Small Towns Improvement
            Project in Brazil. Bank performance on the whole was
            satisfactory, especially during project preparation.
            Borrower performance started well with the highly
            satisfactory preparation of the project, and although
            extremely weak during part of the implementation period, the
            Borrower's overall performance during implementation
            was judged to be satisfactory. The project outcome as a
            whole is rated satisfactory. Project sustainability is rated
            as likely, thanks mostly to the effective participation of
            municipalities and the successful establishment of a State
            Municipal Development Fund (MDF).  The main lessons for
            future projects are that: 1) strong, well-defined
            institutional arrangements are critical to successful
            implementation of the project; 2) attention to the project
            modus operandi is particularly important early on; 3)
            municipalities should be called upon to provide counterpart
            funding, as a means of providing incentives for increased
            own-source revenues, and increasing project ownership; 4)
            the Bank must become more sensitive to political cycles and
            their effect on the project's implementation schedule
            to improve the chances of successful completion; 5) project
            design needs to attach specific performance targets to
            individual project objectives; and 6) although real property
            and betterment taxes proved to be quite small in the context
            of total municipal revenues in the State of Santa Catarina,
            they could play a larger role as a revenue source to municipalities.
